description: An MBA is a PG degree that provides advanced-level skills and knowledge related to business management and leadership . MBA Courses mostly focus on how to apply the case studies in the practical world. To be eligible for pursuing MBA , you need to hold a bachelor’s degree in any discipline with a minimum aggregate of 50% marks. Admissions are based on entrance exams such as CAT, MAT, XAT, GMAT, and then GD, PI and WAT is held.

Top colleges that provide MBA in India are IIM Ahmedabad, IIM Bangalore, IIM Calcutta, MDI, XLRI, FMS, etc. They provide an excellent curriculum and industry-specific knowledge along with good placements. Although pursuing MBA can be on costlier side and the fees can start from INR 2 L to 25 L.

MBA Graduates can expect starting salaries that are ranging from INR 4 -10 LPA, depending on their skills and the recruiter. Renowned recruiters in this field include Boston Consulting Group, McKinsey, Bain & Co, Morgan Stanley, H&M, Aditya Birla Group.

paragraphs: MBA courses are two-year courses divided into four to six semesters. The MBA courses include internships at the end of the first year and campus placements in the final year. In the first year of MBA courses, candidates are taught core subjects and in the second year, they are given an option to choose an MBA specialisation.

There are various types of MBA courses . Some are taught in full-time mode, whereas some are taught in part-time mode. Some MBA programmes are degree courses whereas some of them are diploma courses. Here’s a brief description of the types of MBA courses:
tables: MBA is a full-time two-year course divided into four to six semesters. The MBA courses include internships at the end of the first year and campus placements in the final year. There are about 5,000 full-time MBA colleges in India .

MBA Diploma courses are popularly known as PGDM or PGP programmes. These courses are available in full-time, part-time, distance as well and online modes. The pedagogy, syllabus and recognition of MBA diploma courses are the same as degree courses. The only difference is universities award an MBA degree whereas institutes can award only a diploma.

These are the MBA degree programmes that are taught in distance education mode . Students can pursue this course while working on a 9-5 job or while pursuing another full-time course. The key benefit of a distance MBA course is that it is cheaper compared to a full-time MBA course. There are over 490 Distance MBA colleges in India.

These courses are not residential programmes and are best suited for working professionals who wish to learn key managerial skills. In part-time MBA programmes, there are no campus placement or internship opportunities. Both private colleges and government universities offer part-time MBA courses. There are about 300 Part-Time MBA colleges in India .

This type of MBA is a popular option among working professionals owing to its convenience and flexibility. In Online MBA, classes are conducted online and tests, assessments, etc. are done in the Learning Management System (LMS). There are no physical classes in this type of MBA so anyone can pursue a course in any university from any location. There are about 170 Online MBA colleges in India .

This programme is exclusively designed for working professionals with more than three to five years of work experience. Executive MBA is usually 15-18 months and includes physical classes. There are about 440 Executive MBA Colleges in India .

This is a five-year dual degree MBA course which includes both UG and PG degrees. Minimum qualification required for Integrated MBA class 12 or HSc pass. BBA+MBA and BTech+MBA programmes are two of the most popular Integrated MBA programmes in India.

paragraphs: MBA subjects may differ from college to college in minor aspects but the basic areas of study are the same.
Given below is the table indicating core and elective subjects included in the MBA syllabus .
What Do You Know About CAT, MAT, XAT, CMAT?

In India, MBA entrance exams are conducted that are essential for securing MBA admission in the country. These MBA exams assess the knowledge, aptitude, and skills of candidates and help institutions determine their eligibility for admission.
Here are some of the top MBA entrance exams in India:
CAT is one of the most prestigious and widely recognized MBA entrance exams in India. It is accepted by numerous Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) and other top business schools.
MAT is a national-level entrance exam conducted by the All India Management Association (AIMA). It is accepted by a wide range of B-schools across India.
XAT is conducted by XLRI - Xavier School of Management and is accepted by various top B-schools in India.
NMAT is an entrance exam conducted by the GMAC for admission to various management programs offered by the NMIMS and several other leading B-schools in India and abroad.
SNAP is conducted by Symbiosis International (Deemed University) for admission to its various management programs.
CMAT is a national-level entrance exam conducted by the NTA in India.

GMAT is an internationally recognized exam and is accepted by some Indian B-schools for admission to MBA programs. CMAT is an important entrance exam for admission to various postgraduate management programs, including MBA, PGDM, and similar courses, in numerous B-schools and management institutions across the country.

paragraphs: The MBA syllabus is designed to provide extensive scope for professional improvement and competencies. It includes key aspects of business management such as organizational behavior, human resource management, marketing management, financial management, communication skills, business laws, project work, business environment, etc. Read this article to know all about MBA syllabus and subjects.

There are several specializations in MBA and the aspirants need to examine them before taking admission to this course. For example, if a student wants to enter the hospitality industry can do MBA in Hospital Management, MBA in Hotel Management , and MBA in Healthcare Management . Students can also take admission to MBA in Marketing , MBA in Finance , MBA in Accounting , etc. whatever interest they have.

The MBA syllabus is carefully designed to give business knowledge, leadership skills, and strategic thinking. Finance, marketing, operations, human resources are its main topics and the curriculum makes students industry-ready. It is a mix of core and elective subjects. MBA VS PGDM.summary: While both PGDM and MBA have same outcomes in terms of employment prospects there are some subtle differences. We have listed five differences between PGDM and MBA along with difference between these courses offered by b-schools across India and abroad. Read more on Shiksha

text: PGDM vs MBA- Every aspirant compares the two before choosing a PG management programme. So, what is the difference between PGDM and MBA? Which is better? Read this article to know the similarities and difference between PGDM and MBA.

PGDM and MBAboth are management courses at Master’s level and the course curriculum is the same.  So, 'what is the difference between PGDM and MBA?'The answer is- PGDM is a diploma course, and MBA is a degree course.While, there is not much difference between the two in the job market, a degree is always preferred over a diploma, because a degree is always UGC approved. Also, private universities cannot offer degree without having relevant recognition or accreditation.

MBA and PGDMare both business-orientated courses. The main purpose of both these courses is to train and equip an individual with the latest techniques and skills of business administration and management. In the debate betweenMBA vs PGDM, it is the former that wins as it has more market value.

table_of_contents: 5 key differences between PGDM and MBA
3. PGDM vs MBA: Susceptible to Fraudulence

sections.heading: 5 key differences between PGDM and MBA
content: While both the courses have the same outcome in terms of employment perspective, there are subtle differences such as recognition, fees, etc. Since MBA admission has started for 2026 batch, with CAT , XAT , SNAP exam and registration dates announcements, aspirants must know the difference between MBA and PGDM to make a better choice of course and colleges. Below, we have listed five differences between PGDM and MBA:
At the end of a PGP or PGDM course , the candidate is offered a Diploma. At the end of an MBA programme , the candidate receives a Degree.

Is PGDM same as MBA? Many think that Diploma course does not have the same value as a Degree course but that is not true. Many IIMs and other top B-Schools such as XLRI, Jamshedpur and SPJIMR, Mumbai offer PGP or PGDM courses. Most of these institutes are autonomous bodies (not affiliated to any University). Between a PGDM and an MBA, the difference is of nomenclature but not of professional value.

Both MBA and PGDM are highly valued in the job market as they are same in terms of course accreditation, curriculum and pedagogy. Another key factor is the institute. For example, a PGDM course from XLRI Jamshedpur will have more professional value than a degree course from a state university.
Also Read: Top PGDM Colleges in India: NIRF Ranks, Placements, Fees

sections.heading: 2.MBA vsPGDM:Syllabus
content: In most cases, the MBA course curriculum is designed by the university. The core MBA syllabus (and sometimes even elective subjects) will be pretty much the same in two MBA colleges under the same university. Even though the PGDM syllabus is no different from the MBA syllabus, since PGPM or PGDM courses are determined by the individual institute, it gives them certain flexibility to design the course curriculum. The MBA syllabus undergoes change according to industrial requirements periodically. Universities tend to lag behind in updating the course curriculum.

Since PGP or PGDM courses are offered by autonomous bodies, students need to be careful while taking admission. Many smaller colleges and institutes make claims but do not have proper accreditation status. MBA degrees are conferred by varsities, and hence there’s a lower chance of fraudulent claims. Management aspirants should look for genuine accreditations. Apart from UGC recognition , management institutes are accredited by NAAC, AACSB, AMBA and Equis.

Both MBA and PGDM courses have common core subjects. However, some experts claim most MBA courses focus more on theoretical and technical aspects of management rather than adopting a practical approach. PGP or PGDM courses on the other hand, have an industrial orientation and focus on skills-based on market requirements.

It has been observed that most MBA courses have lower tuition fees as compared to PGP or PGDM courses. This is so because MBA degree is offered mostly by government institutions. These universities receive financial aid and grants from the government, making the degree cheaper for the student. In case of a PGP or PGDM degree, students have to bear the cost of the entire programme as private universities that offer these degrees have no government backing. However, this is not an ironclad rule. There are institutes which charge high tuition fees like the IIMs. The IIMs have high MBA fees despite not-being a private institution. This is because, it is an autonomous institution not funded by the government. However, the MHRD has some role to play in running the IIMs.

content_sections.heading: Difference Between MBA and MSc
content: MBA or Master of Business Administration is a postgraduate degree program that offers advanced management and business training. The course enlightens students with the knowledge and abilities they need to be successful in leadership positions. The growing number of businesses has highlighted the importance of an MBA degree. The fees of MBA courses range between INR 4 Lakh - INR 25 Lakh .

On the other hand, MSc is a two-year postgraduate degree that candidates usually opt for after completing their BSc. MSc is classified as a STEM degree since it emphasizes Science , Engineering , Technology , Mathematics , and Medicine . The fees of MSc courses are less than MBA and can be completed between INR 20,000 to INR 1.2 Lakh.

content_sections.heading: What is an MBA?
content: MBA is a very popular management program that can be pursued in two years. MBA is studied by students after completing their graduation with 50% aggregate marks. MBA equip students with valuable management skills, hence a large number of BTech, BBA, BCom, BA, BSc, and BCA graduates opt for MBA in post-graduation.

The most popular MBA entrance exams are CAT, CMAT, XAT, and MAH CET among others. Some of the popular colleges offering MBA programs in various specializations include IIM Ahmedabad, IIM Bangalore, IIM Calcutta, IIM Lucknow, FMS Delhi, and XLRI among others.

content_sections.heading: What is an MSc?
content: Master of Science (MSc) is very well-liked by candidates hoping to pursue scientific specialisations. The wide range of MSc courses might lead to a lucrative profession. MSc courses can be pursued in a variety of specialisations including Applied Psychology , Life Science, Mathematics , Analytical Chemistry, Neuroscience, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemistry , Physics , Biology , Botany , Biotechnology , etc. MSc courses are designed such that candidates can attain complete knowledge about scientific principles and research.

In India, numerous government colleges provide MSc courses and specialisations. Banaras Hindu University, Jamia Millia Islamia , Delhi University, Jawaharlal Nehru University are some of the colleges that offer MSc courses in India.

faqs.question: Does CUET require OBC certificate?
faqs.answer: Yes, OBC candidates applying for CUET must upload the OBC-NCL certificate in online CUET application form. The OBC-NCL certificate must be issued in consonance with the latest guidelines of the Government of India. If candidate fail to upload the OBC-NCL certificate (issued on or after 01 April, 2024) at the time of CUET 2025 registration, then in such case they will have to upload a declaration in lieu of OBC-NCl certificate to that effect. Candidates belonging to reserved categories are admitted under the seats reserved for them in accordance with the rules prescribed by Government of India. However, in the case of central universities admission, the reservation criteria of the respective university shall be applicable.

faqs.question: How do I apply for a college which requires CUET percentage even though am yet to give CUET?
faqs.answer: Candidates can apply for CUET score accepting colleges through CUET UG 2026 application form. While filling the application form, candidates will be required to enter the name of the preffered universities and courses in order of preference. On declaration of the CUET results, the scores will be shared with the universities for which candidate has applied. Basis on the score obtained candidate will be shortlisted for the applied course.

faqs.question: What if I get compartment, then will I be able to appear for the CUET and get admission in college?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is possible to appear for CUET UG and get admission in college even if candidate gets a compartment in class 12th. However, such candidates will be given provisional admission in colleges. Students must make sure to appear for the compartment exam at given schedule and clear the examination and submit the required documents for verification at college on or before the last date. Candidate must amke sure to enquire about the details before the final admission. Student must meet the college/university requirement.

faqs.question: What is the criteria for admission via CUET exam?
faqs.answer: For admission in Universities through CUET UG 2026, the policies regarding quota, category, relaxation, reservations, qualification, subject combinations, preferences etc of the respective University / Institution shall be applicable. For appearing in CUET exam there is no age limit, however, candidates must check the age criteria (if any) prescribed the university in which candidate is desirous of taking admission. As the CUET eligibility criteria for admission may be unique for every University, the candidates are advised to visit the University website to which they are applying for their respective course and check the subject mapping criteria and age criteria.

faqs.question: How do I select the domain subjects for CUET UG?
faqs.answer: Go on the official website of university/organaisation. Check the courses offered and eligibility test that they should appear in for admission to desired course. The choice of language/domain subject and General test will depend upon the course and university. Candidates will be able to opt for one or more tests as per the requirement of the course and university from the following sections: Section I - 13 Languages Section II - 23 Domain Specific Subjects Section III - General Test

faqs.question: Does CUET require OBC certificate?
faqs.answer: Yes, OBC candidates applying for CUET must upload the OBC-NCL certificate in online CUET application form. The OBC-NCL certificate must be issued in consonance with the latest guidelines of the Government of India. If candidate fail to upload the OBC-NCL certificate (issued on or after 01 April, 2024) at the time of CUET 2025 registration, then in such case they will have to upload a declaration in lieu of OBC-NCl certificate to that effect. Candidates belonging to reserved categories are admitted under the seats reserved for them in accordance with the rules prescribed by Government of India. However, in the case of central universities admission, the reservation criteria of the respective university shall be applicable.

faqs.question: How do I apply for a college which requires CUET percentage even though am yet to give CUET?
faqs.answer: Candidates can apply for CUET score accepting colleges through CUET UG 2026 application form. While filling the application form, candidates will be required to enter the name of the preffered universities and courses in order of preference. On declaration of the CUET results, the scores will be shared with the universities for which candidate has applied. Basis on the score obtained candidate will be shortlisted for the applied course.

faqs.question: What if I get compartment, then will I be able to appear for the CUET and get admission in college?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is possible to appear for CUET UG and get admission in college even if candidate gets a compartment in class 12th. However, such candidates will be given provisional admission in colleges. Students must make sure to appear for the compartment exam at given schedule and clear the examination and submit the required documents for verification at college on or before the last date. Candidate must amke sure to enquire about the details before the final admission. Student must meet the college/university requirement.

faqs.question: What is the criteria for admission via CUET exam?
faqs.answer: For admission in Universities through CUET UG 2026, the policies regarding quota, category, relaxation, reservations, qualification, subject combinations, preferences etc of the respective University / Institution shall be applicable. For appearing in CUET exam there is no age limit, however, candidates must check the age criteria (if any) prescribed the university in which candidate is desirous of taking admission. As the CUET eligibility criteria for admission may be unique for every University, the candidates are advised to visit the University website to which they are applying for their respective course and check the subject mapping criteria and age criteria.

faqs.question: How do I select the domain subjects for CUET UG?
faqs.answer: Go on the official website of university/organaisation. Check the courses offered and eligibility test that they should appear in for admission to desired course. The choice of language/domain subject and General test will depend upon the course and university. Candidates will be able to opt for one or more tests as per the requirement of the course and university from the following sections: Section I - 13 Languages Section II - 23 Domain Specific Subjects Section III - General Test

paragraphs: CAT 2025 cut offs for IIMs are same as last yeer. PI shortlists 2026 have been released on the basis of same cut offs. CAT cut offs 2025 for top IIMs such as IIM Ahmedabad, IIM Bangalore, IIM Calcutta, IIM Lucknow and IIM Kozhikode are  99.97+ percentile for General category students For SC/ST/PwD category candidates the CAT 2025 cut offs are slightly lower. For non-IIMs, the minimum CAT cutoff 2025 are around 94 percentile. In Tier 2 MBA colleges, CAT cut offs are around 70-80 percentile and above and in Tier 3 MBA colleges the CAT cut offs usually around 60-70 percentile and above.

The CAT qualifying cut offs are the minimum score requirement for PI shortlisting. For all IIMs the qualifying cut offs are same this year. But, IIM Ahmedabad CAT 2025 cut off has increased from 80 percentile to 95 percentile.

headings: What is IIM CAT qualifying cut off?
paragraphs: The CAT qualifying cut off is the minimum score required by a candidate to be eligible for selection to the WAT-PI round. Which means a candidate who has scored as much or above the final cut off score can apply for IIM PI round but may not be selected.
The qualifying CAT cut off is much lower than the final cut off. For example, the qualifying CAT cut off for IIM Bangalore is 80 percentile but the final CAT cut off is 99.95 percentile and above.

Final cut offs for 2026 batch admission have been released after the announcement of CAT 2025 result. The final CAT cut offs are however not revealed publically. Presented below are the estimated CAT cut off percentiles for General category students for admission to the top 21 IIMs. The below mentioned cut offs are the estimated final cut offs on the basis of which the candidates will be called for the interview round.

The CAT 2025 cut offs for top MBA colleges will be lower than the top IIMs but still high at 95 percentile and above. There are some top ranked MBA colleges that have CAT cut offs in 70-80 percentiles too. Presented below are expected CAT 2025 cut off percentiles for General category students for admission to some of the top MBA colleges (non-IIM) in 2025.

For admission to MBA courses, B-Schools consider CAT percentile which is calculated from the scaled scores of all test takers. CAT scaled score is not the same as raw CAT score. It is the score arrived at after normalisation of the raw scores of all candidates across exam slots. This is done to ensure that every candidate's performance across the exam sessions are judged on the same scale and no one gets the advantage of solving an easier CAT test form or the disadvantage of solving a tougher test form

A high CAT score may not convert into high percentile if a large number of candidates have scored the same or higher. However, an estimation can be calculated based on number of test takers and difficulty level of CAT exam for that year. intro: To calculate exam score with CAT response sheet and answer key , candidates have to add and subtract marks per question as per the official status - correct, incorrect or unanswered. They can martch their responses in the answer key and calculate expected marks.
There is negative marking in CAT so while calculating the score, candidates need to keep that in mind. Given below is the table indicating latest marking scheme of the CAT exam
Note: There will be no deduction of marks for unanswered questions and for incorrect attempt in non-MCQs.

Based on the marking scheme, CAT raw score can be calculated as; 0 correct attempts means (50x3 = 150 marks). 10 incorrect attempts means minus 10. Thus, the raw score Will be 140.

sections.section_title: Selection Procedure of IIMs Through CAT Score
intro: The IIMs select candidates who meet the cut off fixed for the academic year. Those candidates have to appear for PI and WAT. IIM admission process of all 21 institutes lasts for three to four months and the classes commence from June-July. Admission procedure of non-IIMs also get over around the same time.
IIM admission 2026 will be based on three parameters including, CAT 2025 result, WAT/GD-PI, academic record. The IIM admission procedure 2026 includes the following stages:
First phase: Shortlisting of candidates through CAT 2025
Second phase: WAT/GD-PI round
Third phase: Final selection
IIM Selection Process Through CAT

Each test takers will be shortlisted on the basis of his/her CAT score viz-a-viz CAT cut offs fixed by each IIM individually for that year. Minimum IIM cut-offs are generally over 90 percentile for General candidates (much lower for reserved category candidates), which means, those who will score above 90 percentile in CAT will be eligible for the interview round. But whether they are invited for the interview, depends on the actual CAT score and past academic record. CAT cut-offs of newer IIMs will range between 70-80 percentile.

In this phase, IIMs will conduct WAT/PI round. This stage is the decider as the selection panel finalises a candidate on the basis of their performance in this round. A few years ago, the IIMs replaced GD with WAT. For the past coupile of years, some of the IIMs conduct only the PI.

In this phase, the candidates will be scored on the basis of their academic performance and work experience. Here’s a break up of parameters on which candidates will be selected for IIM admission 2026.
*The above table contains parameters and weight of IIM Bangalore for CAT 2024. Weights of each parameter varies for each IIM year on year.

On the basis of CAT percentile, candidates are shortlisted for WAT/GD-PI processes. Following is an example of the process of calculation of Composite Score for shortlisting for WAT/GD-PI, issued by IIM Lucknow :
Common Admission Process or CAP is conducted for IIM Bodhgaya, IIM Sirmaur and IIM Jammu. Under this process, common rules and guidelines are followed for selection of candidates for admission.

The admission process of nine new IIMs comprise same selection process like older IIMs, that is, Written Ability Test or Group Discussion and Personal Interview . Qualifying CAT cut off and weightage of selection parameters are also common to these nine IIMs, but much lower than older IIMs. It is easier to get through Baby IIMs as the selection criteria is also not as stringent as top IIMs.
Also Read: What is IIM CAP? Check Details

IIM Written Ability Test or WAT will be an essay writing test in which candidates will be given a topic to write upon in fifteen to thirty minutes. The topics of WAT can be from any field, thus candidates must read on various topics. The purpose of WAT will be to check the candidate’s clarity of ideas and understanding of his/her surroundings.

The IIM Personal Interview round is the most crucial round of IIMs admission. It carries about 30-40 per cent weight in selection process. In PI, the candidates will have to face a panel of two to four interviewers who will assess them on their confidence, communication skills, managerial skills and leadership qualities, etc. The main line of questioning is usually on the field of study or career of the candidate. The secret of succeeding in this round is staying calm and being honest with your answers.

MBA aspirants must start WAT-PI preparation immediately after CAT exam so that they get enough time before colleges start conducting the selection round. Check out WAT-PI experiences of candidates who converted IIM interview calls.

sections.heading: CAT Exam Day Instructions 2025
process_steps: Candidates must carry two copies of the CAT 2025 admit card and a photo ID proof (original and photocopy)
Only IIM CAT admit card and photo ID card are allowed inside the exam hall
Candidates must reach the CAT exam centre as per the reporting time mentioned in their admit card.
Candidates must use the Reference Number printed on the CAT 2025 admit card for identifying the door/wing/lab at the test venue on the day of the test.
Candidates are not supposed to sign their CAT admit card beforehand. The admit card is to be signed only inside the exam hall in front of the invigilator.
Candidates must affix their photo on the admit card printouts. The photo should be same as iuploaded in the CAT application form.
Mobile phone, calculator, IPad or any other gadget is prohibited inside the examination hall.
Candidates are advised not to carry bags or luggage to the CAT 2025 exam centre as there will be no provision of bag deposit.
Jackets, hoodie, coats, cardigans with pocket, caps and headgeard will not be allowed.
Jewellery that contains metal, clothes with pockets, jackets and footwear are prohibited inside the exam hall.
Candidates with a metal implant, pacemaker, etc. in their body will be required to bring medical certificate of the same.
Writing pad and pen will be provided by the authorities for rough work which will have to be submitted before leaving the test hall.
Candidates will be required to write their name and registration number on the writing pad.
Candidates must leave the invigilator's copy of their CAT admit card 2025 in the examination hall.

sections.section_title: Documents Required for CAT 2025 Application Form
content: Candidates will have to mention personal as well as academic details in the CAT application form 2026. So, before filling the CAT form, candidates must have the following documents:
• Final year certificate from principal, HoD or Director (if applicable)
• Credit/debit card or net banking credentials
What are the Documents to Upload with CAT Form?
Candidates had to upload certain documents with the CAT form. Given below are the details of the documents to be uploaded in the CAT 2026 application form.

Scanned Passport Size Photograph | The photo should be recent, not more than six months old. The photo should be within the dimensions of 1200 pixels x 1200 pixels and in . jpg or .jpeg format. The resolution must not be more than 80 KB and less than 150 px/inch in resolution.

Scanned Signature | The signature must be within the dimensions of 80mm X 35mm and in .jpg or .jpeg . It should be clear and on white background. The signature should not be more than 80 KB and less than 150 px/inch in resolution.

NC-OBC/SC/ST Certificate | If you belong to NC-OBC, SC or ST category, you will have to download the caste certificate from the CAT website, enter the required information, self-attest it and upload its scanned copy as a PDF document.
PwD Certificate | If you belong to PwD category, you are required to download the PwD certificate from the CAT website, fill it, self-attest it and upload its scanned copy as PDF document.

Final Year Certificate | Candidates who are in the final year of their bachelor's degree programme are required to upload the Final year certificate from the Principal, HoD, Registrar or Director certifying the applicant has obtained at least 50% marks (45% in case of SC/ST/PWD candidates) or equivalent based on latest available grades/marks on College/Institution’s letterhead. The certificate format can be downloaded from the IIMCAT website.
CAT 2026 Application Process: Selection of Test Cities

At the time of filling the CAT form , it is mandatory for candidates to mention preferred test centre location by selecting up to five options from the list of 170 cities. However, allotment of the CAT test city will be subject to availability of seats at the centre.So, sooner a candidate submits the CAT application form, higher the chances of getting preferres test cituy.

intro: CAT syllabus 2026 will include Verbal Ability & Reading Comprehension (VARC), Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning (DILR) and Quantitative Aptitude (QA) . No change is expected in the exam syllabus as the sections included are considered to be the best tools to evaluate a management aspirant's communication skills, quantitative ability and reasoning skills. Over the years, CAT exam syllabus has remained constant.

The syllabus of CAT exam is vast and requires in-depth study over a period of time. Also the difficulty level of CAT questions poses challenge in scoring high. So, those planning to appear for CAT 2026 must start exploring the syllabus. Read below all the details related to the CAT 2026 syllabus.

content: The first thing is to know, "what is CAT Syllabus?" So, here are the key highlights of CAT 2026 syllabus for CAT preparation :

• The CAT VARC section has two parts - Verbal Reasoning and Reading Comprehension. All of the 24 questions are divided between the two and there are no direct Grammar or Vocabulary questions. RC passage based questions are 12 to14 and parajumble/para-completion/odd sentence questions are about 8 to 10.

• The CAT Quantitative Aptitude syllabus Arithmetic, Geometry, Algebra, Trigonometry and Mensuration . These are essentially Math topics that one has studied in class 9 and 10, but of advance level. Maximum questions are based on Arithmetic so focus on it more during preparation. Algebra and Geometry topics make up for 4-5 questions.

• The DILR syllabus of CAT exam includes topics like Puzzles, Pie Charts, Tables, Bar Graphs, Coding-Decoding, Series, Family Tree, Blood Relations, Syllogism, etc. The questions appear in sets. But candidates must not try to solve all the questions in the given set. If they get stuck on any, they must move to next question/set.

VARC section is the first section of the CAT question paper and has 24 questions. In CAT 2026, the section will b divided into two sub-parts, Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension . There will be no vocabulary questions. CAT VARC is usually considered tough due to presence of 12-14 RC based questions. But parajumbles can also be confusing. Take a look at important VARC topics for CAT exam syllabus.
Foreign language words used in English

CAT VARC section as mentioned earlier, includes four major sub-topics – Reading Comprehension, Parajumbles, Verbal Ability and Odd Sentence. There are no grammar based questions in CAT. Composition of CAT VARC section is usually the same every year. So, can expect the same in CAT 2026. Given below is the weightage and difficulty level of VARC as per CAT 2025 question paper.
No. of Questions in CAT Exam

Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning (DILR) is the second section of the CAT question paper having 22 questions to be solved in 40 minutes. There are two sub sections - Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning. CAT 2026 question paper is expected to have 11 question each from both sub sections. Most of the questions are asked in sets of 3-4, Only a few questions in LR are standalone ones. This section requires a lot of practice and one should solve a good number of practice questions from all topics. Take a look at important CAT Logical Reasoning and Data Interpretation topics.

The Data Interpretation questions are usually based on tables and graphs. However, Logical Reasoning questions can be from varied topics including verbal, non-verbal and abstract reasoning. Quantitative Aptitude is the last section of CAT question paper. It is usually the toughest section. To master CAT QA, candidates need to be thorough with the fundamentals of Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry and Mensuration. Memorising theorems and formulae is the key. Take a look at the important topics of CAT Quantitative Aptitude syllabus and some key points:

The CAT Quant questions are usually tough and calculation based. In a speed based test like CAT, mental maths is very useful in solving Quants questions quickly. So candidates must practice mental maths along with CAT preparation for better performance. Given below is the composition of the Quantitative Aptitude section:

To crack CAT 2026 with high percentile, make a preparation plan based on your knowledge of the topics included in the syllabus. Quantitative Aptitude topics are advanced level Maths taught in school and so is the case with English Grammar. So, the first thing to do for CAT 2026 preparation is to make the list of topics in terms of familiarity – familiar, somewhat familiar and not familiar at all . There will be some CAT topics which will require revision and some which will need to be addressed afresh.

Start with unfamiliar topics of the CAT syllabus and then move to somewhat familiar and finally to familiar topics. This order is suggested because one will need more time for preparing unfamiliar topics. Solve a lot of practice questions alongside to learn application of the concepts. Mere theoretical knowledge is not enough to crack CAT exam, so practice as much as you can. Take a look at some section-wise tips for CAT 2026 preparation below:
Shiksha has created free CAT Mock Tests for aspirants to practice and prepare for the exam. These CAT mock tests are based on actual CAT questions to keep the level of difficulty same.

• VARC preparation should start at the early stage, specifically Reading Comprehension practice
• Check the CAT exam syllabus and revise all the Grammar rules and definitions
• Get hold of an English dictionary and word meaning books to learn new words and phrases

• RC dominates VARC section with more than 50 per cent weightage so it is important have the practice of speed-reading. This can be developed by reading books, novels, magazines and data heavy reports.
• Read books of various genres. Your collection should have books from science and tech to history to philosophy.
• However, to understand passages swiftly and choose answers quickly, candidates must practice RC passages based CAT mocks.
• The best method to crack VARC CAT questions is practice. Solve a large number and a wide range of CAT Verbal Ability questions from the topics listed in the syllabus to master this section.
• Refer to past 10 years' CAT question papers to understand the types of reading comprehension and parajumble questions that are asked. In CAT 2026, the passage types will be similar.
• CAT parajumble questions can be equally challenging as RC questions. You must solve various types of CAT parajumble questions for practice.
• Focus on English grammar, usage of words, foreign language words, and idioms. These will help in both RC and parajumbles.

• Start practicing full length and sectional CAT mock tests only after completing the syllabus
• Divide practice sessions into – easy, moderate and high . Start solving easy CAT questions first, then move to moderately high questions and then to tough questions.

• Time yourself while solving questions and solve each of them at least three times. The first attempt is to understand the question, second attempt is to solve it with 100 per cent accuracy and the third attempt is to solve it will 100 per cent accuracy and speed.

intro: CAT exam pattern 2026 is expected to be same as last year . The CAT question paper 2026 will have three sections - VARC, DILR and Quantitative Aptitude, having sectional time limit of 40 minutes each. Total time duration will be 120 minutes per session. There willl be a total of 68 questions like last year. VARC will have 24 questions whereas, DILR and Quantitative Aptitude will have 22 questions each.

CAT exam 2026 will be conducted on November 29 and registrations will start in the first week of August. The CAT 2026 exam pattern document will be released along with the exam notification.  Read below all about test pattern of CAT exam .

sections.section_title: CAT Exam Pattern 2026 - Overall and Sectional Time Limit
content: CAT exam has sectional time-limit. Which means that candidates have to attempt the test in pre-defined order and in the given time duration. The order to follow in CAT question paper is:

Aspirants have to complete every section in 40 minutes. After the stipulated 40 minutes are over, the test screen will automatically move to the next section. No changes, corrections or submissions will be allowed after that. PwD candidates will get 13 minutes extra per section. Check the table below for suggested time management plan for CAT 2026 exam.
Use of onscreen calculator will be allowed for computation during the CAT 2026 exam.
An onscreen clock will help candidates to keep a check on time during the exam.
Sheets of paper will be provided for rough work, which will have to be submitted before to the invigilator.
Candidates will not be allowed to start test before time. They will be allowed to login only after announcement.
Candidates must remain seated at their seats throughout the exam. If found sitting anywhere else, he/she will be disqualified.
Important Points About CAT Test Process
• Use of onscreen calculator will be allowed for computation during the CAT 2026 exam.
• An onscreen clock will help candidates to keep a check on time during the exam.
• The screen will move to next section as soon as 40 minutes are over. Once the window moves to next section, candidates will not be allowed to go back.
• If not sure of an answer, candidates can mark it as 'save for later' but they will have to ensure they revisit the question within the 40 minutes of that section.
• Candidates must read exam instructions given on the first page of the test screen.
• To be best prepared for the online test process of CAT 2026, candidates must take the official CAT mock test and check the offiical test guide.
• Sheets of paper will be provided for rough work, which will have to be submitted before to the invigilator.
• Candidates will not be allowed to start test before time. They will be allowed to login only after announcement.
• Candidates must remain seated at their seats throughout the exam. If found sitting anywhere else, he/she will be disqualified.
• They should aim to complete every section 5-10 minutes before time so that they can go back to questions saved for review.
• The CAT test form will close as soon as the time gets over. Candidates however will have to remain seated until the exit process is started.
• Section 1: Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension
• Section 2: Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning

CAT has negative marking so candidates must mark answers carefully. They should mark an answer only if they are sure of it otherwise they should skip it to prevent negative marking. However, in TITA questions they can do guess work if they nearly know the answer, as there in no negative marking for them. Candidates must try to attempt 2/3rd of the total questions in every section for a decent overall score.
Also Read: CAT preparation plan: Tips and Tricks: https://www.shiksha.com/mba/cat-exam-preparation

The CAT is a computer based test which means candidates have to take the test on a computer system. At the exam centre, every candidate is alloted a particular seat and a computer system. They will have to login to access the test form. For every CAT question, four options will be given to choose the correct answer. Candidates will have to mark their answer options with the help of a computer mouse. For TITA question, candidates can use the keypad. Candidates will have to select the correct answer and click on one of the following options to move to next question:
CAT Test Pattern 2026: How to Mark Answers in Test Form?
• Save and Next Clear Response Mark for Review and Next
Key Points About Marking Answers in CAT exam:
• Candidates must note that once they have submitted a question (save and next) they cannot change it.
• Incase, they are not sure of the answer, they should exercise 'mark for review and next' option.
• At the same time, they must go back to the questions marked for review before the time limit for that section gets over.
• If they haven't saved their final answer to any question, it will be reported as unanswered and 0 mark will be awarded.

sections.section_title: Changes in CAT Question Paper Pattern Over The Years
content: Until 2019, CAT was a 3-hour exam. It was held in 2 shifts. From 2020 onwards, it is being conducted for 2 hours in three shifts. The number of questions have also been reduced over the last seven years. Given below is a table indicating changes in CAT exam pattern since 2014:

The IIM has tried to modify CAT in such a way that it becomes more non-engineering student friendly. The CAT has been traditionally considered to be more tilted towards candidates from engineering background. But over the years, the IIMs have strived to increase academic and gender diversity in MBA classrooms.

sections.section_title: Difference Between CAT Exam Pattern and Other MBA Entrance Exams?
content: The exam pattern of all MBA entrance exams are similar but have some peculiarities. If you compare, CAT exam pattern will come across as the most student friendly with 66 questions and 120 minutes. There is also sectional time limit, so candidates have no pressure of time management by self to ensure they do not ignore any section. However, for most of the aspirants, sectional time limit is a challenge. In other MBA entrance exams, they can toggle between sections or time themselves according to strong and weak areas. However, this is not possible in CAT. Check below basic difference between CAT pattern and that of other MBA entrance exams.

sections.section_title: CAT Preparation: Understand CAT Syllabus and Pattern
content: The most important aspect of CAT preparation is knowing every topic of CAT syllabus thoroughly. CAT Quantitative Aptitude includes advance level Mathematics topics studied in Class 9-10. So, if you have strong base in Maths, CAT quantitative aptitude will not be a challenge in preparation. You will only need revision and a good amount of practice. Infact, it is CAT VARC, that a majoriy of aspirants find tough to crack as the RC passages are long, dense and inference based. If you study in a time bound manner, you will be able to cover the CAT syllabus properly, irrespective of your educational background. Practicing sample questions regularly, will help you in cracking tough topics. Check important topics of CAT syllabus 2026 in the table below:

sections.section_title: CAT Quantitative Aptitude Preparation Tips and Strategy
content: Quantitative Aptitude section includes Mathematics topics such as Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry and Mensuration . To excel in this section of CAT exam you must have thorough knowledge of concepts, formulae and theorems. Having a good command on fundamentals of Arithmetic, Geometry and Algebra will help you immensely. Also, mental calculation plays a major role in scoring well in this section. Although an on screen calculator will be provided in the CAT 2026 exam, mental calculation will save your precious time. Here are some tips for CAT Quantitative Aptitude preparation:
CAT Preparation Plan For Quantitative Aptitude
How To Prepare For Quantitative Aptitude For CAT Exam
Master The Secret of Acing QA In CAT Exam
How To Approach Quant Section of CAT Exam
Six Strategies of CAT Quant Preparation
• Get CAT exam study material which has a good number of sample questions on these topics.
• Cover the topics end to end. Do not leave out any topic of Arithmetic and Algebra as most of the questions are asked from these two topics.
• Break down your CAT Quant preparation into phases. Start with topics, then move to practice questions and then to mock tests.
• Start with easy topics and then move to tough ones. Starting with easy topics will give you confidence.
• Revise important formulae and theorem every day in the last one month.
• Practice sectional mock tests for Quantitative Aptitude to learn how to handle 40 minutes in the exam.

sections.section_title: CAT VARC Preparation Tips and Strategy
content: The CAT VARC section is broadly divided into Reading Comprehension and Verbal Ability . To prepare for this section of CAT exam, candidates need to have a separate approach for each part. For example, preparation of Reading Comprehension should begin in early months of the year as it all about developing and cultivating the habit of reading. CAT Verbal Ability can be tackled by practicing sample questions and can be done in lesser time. However, the CAT VARC is mostly about RC, parajumbles, odd sentence out and para completion , you need to focus on practice of exercises based on these.

Although there is no direct English Grammar or Vocabulary questions, candidates must study these too as the very basis of correct interpretation of Language comprehension and Verbal Ability are word meanings and Grammar.

sections.section_title: CAT DILR Preparation Tips and Strategy
content: To score well in CAT Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning or DILR , the most important thing is to have clarity of basic concepts. Since the questions in this section are data and logic based, candidates need to develop sharp observation and eye for detail. Also, there are no formulas or theorems in DILR, so your preparation majorly depends on practice of sample questions. Major topics to study for DILR are Tables, Line Charts, Pie Charts, Bar Charts, Mixed Charts. Strengthen your Mathematical calculation ability for DILR. Get hold of CAT study material having a good number of sample questions on these topics.

sections.section_title: CAT Preparation with Mock Tests and Previous Years' Question Papers
content: It is recommended that candidates must practice about 40-45 CAT mock tests during the preparation phase. The aim of a CAT mock test is to improve application, accuracy and speed. If you have reached a stage where you're consistently performing well in the mock tests (high difficulty level) you can slow down. It is not mandatory for all candidates to solve 40-45 mock tests. You can be prepared equally well by solving lesser number of mock tests. Judge your capacity.

Aspirants must start practicing CAT mock test after they have completed the syllabus. They must dedicate the second half of CAT preparation phase to it. The key here is to analyse each mock test result to see where you stand and how much more practice you need. One tip you should follow is to not practice mock tests continuously till the exam day. In the last week of CAT preparation 2025, attempt only one mock test for confidence. Irrespective of the result of that CAT mock test, you will score well in the exam.

IIMCAT releases official CAT mock test a month before the exam to help candidates prepare themselves for the actual exam. The official CAT mock test is replica of the exam and provides an insight of the exam pattern for that year. The official mock test provides a sneak peek of the final CAT exam. Every candidate must attempt the official CAT mock test, which can be accessed online on the official IIMCAT website.
Shiksha has also created CAT mock tests for candidates to practice and strengthen their preparation. Given below are two CAT mock tests you can practice for free.

To further strengthen CAT preparation, candidates must attempt previous years' CAT question papers to understand the latest question type and topic wise weightage. For example, if Arithmetic dominates Quantitative Aptitude section of CAT, which type of Arithmetic questions are there. Practicing actual CAT questions from previous years will boost your confidence. Check here CAT question papers of previous years and download PDF.

sections.section_title: CAT Preparation Tips That Will Enhance Your Performance
content: Download MBA preparation mobile apps to prepare for CAT exam anywhere and anytime.
Practice CAT question papers and mock tests to improve speed and accuracy.
Measure your performance after each CAT mock test. Analyse strengths and weaknesses and work upon them.

Solve each CAT practice question at least thrice, because in the first attempt, you will understand it, in the second attempt you will solve it faster, and in the third attempt you may discover a shortcut.
CAT exam has sectional time limit. So practice questions in time bound manner. Opt for CAT sectional mock tests.
CAT exam has negative marking. For each wrong answer 1 mark is deducted. To avoid this, understand your strong areas and learn how to pick the right question to solve.
CAT has sectional cut off limit, so do not ignore any topic. The sectional cut off directly affects the overall CAT percentile and selection in WAT-GD/PI.
• Download MBA preparation mobile apps to prepare for CAT exam anywhere and anytime.
• Practice CAT question papers and mock tests to improve speed and accuracy.
• Measure your performance after each CAT mock test. Analyse strengths and weaknesses and work upon them.

• Solve each CAT practice question at least thrice, because in the first attempt, you will understand it, in the second attempt you will solve it faster, and in the third attempt you may discover a shortcut.
• CAT exam has sectional time limit. So practice questions in time bound manner. Opt for CAT sectional mock tests.
• Solve CAT questions of various types and varied difficulty levels. By the CAT 2026 exam day, you should be able to solve easy, moderate as well as tough questions.
• CAT exam has negative marking. For each wrong answer 1 mark is deducted. To avoid this, understand your strong areas and learn how to pick the right question to solve.

• Do not do speed reading in RC. Nor should you go for reverse reading, i.e. reading the questions first and passage later. Read the RC passage and note down important points in the rough sheet. This way you will be able to address the questions easily.
• CAT has sectional cut off limit, so do not ignore any topic. The sectional cut off directly affects the overall CAT percentile and selection in WAT-GD/PI.
• Practice time-bound CAT mock tests as part of your CAT prep strategy. It will help you to develop time management skills.

• Keep your CAT 2026 preparation optimum but do not over do anything. If you have prepared certain topics already. Do not work on them again and again. Focus on topics that are still your pain points.
• Memorise tables up to 20, square, square roots, cubes, cube roots, etc. These will help you in mental calculation during the CAT exam .
• Revise all the concepts of VA and LR and formulae of QA every day for one hour. You should be so well versed with these that on the exam day, you can recall them without wasting a single moment.
• In the last phase, focus completely on mock tests and revision. This is the crucial time when you can take your CAT score from 95 to 99 percentile.

paragraphs: CAT notification is a document that contains CAT exam date, conducting institute, registration dates, exam pattern, exam fees, eligibility criteria, reservation, selection criteria, score calculation process, etc.

sections.heading: CAT Exam Pattern 2025
paragraphs: CAT exam pattern 2025 was same as CAT 2024; the number of DILR questions were higher in 2024 than previous years. Have a look at the highlights of CAT exam pattern:

CAT question papers are released within a week of the exam in the form of a PDF as a response sheet and answer key. Candidates who have appeared for the test are able to access the CAT question paper and answer key. The question paper of every slot is released on the same day along with candidate response sheet and official answer to all question. If any candidate needs previous year CAT question papers for preparation purpose, then they can download them from Shiksha website. We have hosted last five years' CAT question papers for aspirants to download and practice. These official CAT question papers are available for download free. You can download the CAT question paper PDFs at this link: https://www.shiksha.com/mba/cat-exam-question-papers Candidates must check and practice the latest CAT question paper to know the latest exam pattern and difficulty level.

There is no age limit to appear for CAT. The CAT exam is open for fresh graduates as well as working professionals. Since CAT is accepted by over 1300 B-schools across India for their full-time as well as executive MBA or online professional courses, a lot of working professionals appear for the CAT to pursue such courses. CAT score is accepted by Iims for full time MBA, executive MBA and FPM programmes.

Other top MBA colleges in India also shortlist candidates for executive MBA or part-time MBA on the basis of CAT score. sections.heading: CAT Registration and Fees 2025
paragraphs: CAT registration process is online. The CAT notification 2025 explains the process of exam registration through a PDF document. Check below, CAT registration cum application process 2025:

The CAT 2025 notification has information related to application fee to be paid by candidates for form submission. Given below is the CAT application fee for students belonging to General and Reserved categories, for previous year:

The CAT form correction window usually opens for 2-3 days. It opens a day after the last date of CAT registration. For example, if the CAT registration 2025 will end on September 13, the form correction window will open on September 14 and close on September 17, 2025. If the CAT registration window is extended by a week, then th form correction window will open thereafter.

Only registered candidates, who shall have paid the application fee will be able to access their CAT 2025 application forms to make changes. CAT form correction is a one-time activity so candidates must not miss the chance of updating their photo, signature and changing test city choices if required.

sections.heading: CAT Test Centres 2025
paragraphs: CAT test centres are the designated locations having computer labs where candidates have to appear for the exam. The CAT exam centres are administered by TCS in collaboration with IIM. The CAT exam is conducted at over 400 such test centres in 170 cities of India. The CAT notification contains the list of test cities.
The CAT exam centre allotment is based on candidate’s preferred choice of city. Here’s how:

There are over 170 cities where CAT exam is held. These 170 cities are spread across India consist of metropolitan cities, capital cities, Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities. Candidate can select up to five cities for allotment of test centre. The process of test city selection is a part of CAT application process. In the CAT application form, there is a field in which candidates have to select the cities. They need to select the city of preference in order of 1 to 5. The examination authorities will try to allot the test centre in the city of first preference. Thus, candidates must fill all the five cities carefully. They must choose their home city of city of current residence as the first preference. The test city option can only be changed during the form correction window. After that, the request for change of the city will not be accepted by the exam authorities.

CAT exam is held in about 170 cities across India. Candidates can choose up to six cities as their preferred test location. The list of test cities for CAT is available in application form. Candidates should choose the test city carefully as the request to change the test city later may or may not be accepted due to non-availability of seats at the centres in that particular city. paragraphs: The IIMCAT notification also has the list of courses offered through CAT in the 21 IIMs. CAT score is valid for not only full time MBA but also other PG courses. It can be used for admission to PhD, EMBA, FPM and other certifications too. Here is the list of courses offered by the IIMs through CAT as mentioned in the official notification. After the declaration of CAT results, IIMs and other top MBA colleges start the candidate shortlisting process. The institutes fix CAT cut offs category wise and invite applicants to appear for Written Ability Test, Group Discussion GD and Personal Interview PI rounds for MBA Admission. In case of IIMs, the institutes release PI shortlist form which the candidates have to fill before a certain deadline. In the PI form, candidates have to mention their personal, academic and professional details along with CAT score. Depending on the application received and the range of CAT scores the institutes the shortlist candidates for What-GD-PI. The What-GD-PI round is conducted by the institutes individually in March and April in online or offline mode. With the result of What-GD-PI and candidates' overall profile, the institutes finalise the list of students for admission. Offer of admission letters to selected candidates are sent via email in May.

sections.heading: CAT Exam Centre: Dos and Don’ts

paragraphs.text: The CAT exam centres have elaborate identification process for which 1.5 hours are allotted before commencement of the slot. If a candidate’s exam starts at 8:30 AM, they need to reach their CAT test centre by 7:00 AM. For candidates taking the exam in second slot, reporting time is 10:00 AM. We have listed down a few dos and don’ts to follow at their CAT 2025 test locations.
CAT exam centre dos and don'ts

items: Carry two print outs of CAT admit card 2025, ID proof (in original) and a pen to the exam centre.
Show the original print out of your CAT 2025 admit card to gain entry into the exam centre.
Follow the instructions and cooperate in identification and frisking at the entry gate.
Use the Reference Number printed on your CAT admit card to locate your exam hall, go inside and be seated at your designated work station.
Do not carry electronic items to the exam centre. Closed shoes, belts, caps, jackets and other outfit and accessories with metal are prohibited inside the exam hall.
Test centre gates will close 15 minutes prior to the exam, thus do not get late for the exam.
Do not argue with test centre staff or other candidates. Unruly behavior may invite disqualification.
Do not use keyboard at any point of time during the exam or your system will automatically get locked.

headings: Top MBA Colleges in India With Low Fees
1. Faculty of Management Studies (FMS), Delhi University
text: Admission to MBA colleges in India is based on entrance exams, so while shortlisting an MBA college with low fees, also check the qualifying score required and prepare for the relevantMBA entrance exam. Here is thelist of affordable MBA colleges 2025 in India:

Faculty of Management Studiesis one of the top-ranking management institutes in India, which offers MBA courses at the cheapest prices starting atINR 2.32 Lakhonly. It is one of the most prestigious and affordable MBA colleges in the country, which is affiliated with Delhi University. The selection procedure at the institute includesCATscores and Personal Interviews. The average salary package in campus placement this year was INR 34.1 LPA. FMS is one of thetop MBA colleges with low fees and good placements. Companies such as Deloitte, OLA, PwC, L'Oreal, Info Edge, Adobe, Google, Amazon, etc. offer placements to students of FMS.
Also Read:How to prepare for CAT exam 2025?

headings: 2. Jamnalal Bajaj Institute of Management Studies (JIBMS), Mumbai
3. Tata Institute of Management Studies (TISS), Mumbai
5. Department of Financial Studies, Delhi University
text: JBIMS was founded in 1965 and is affiliated with the University of Mumbai. It is a public institute that offers full-time and part-time MMS programmes.JBIMSalso offers a variety of other programmes but MBA is one of the most popular courses of JBIMS. The current fee structure isINR 6.10 lakhfor two years of its MBA programme. The college accepts scores of CAT/MAH CET/MAT/ATMA. The institute ranks among the top 10 B-schools in India and has a large alumni base who are working as CEOs, and along with this, JBIMS has a place in thecheapest MBA colleges in India. The average salary package isINR 26.12 LPA.Companies for placements in JBIMS include McKinsey & Company, JP Morgan Chase, Accenture, Axis Bank, JP Morgan, Amazon, etc.

TISS, Mumbai, is another management institution that offers quality MBA education at an affordable MBA fee. Admissions intoTISSwere earlier offered based on the TISSNET score, but now admissions to TISS are being done through theCentral University Entrance Test-PG or CUET PG. The fee of an MBA course at TISS isINR 1.4 Lakhand the average salary from the placements wasINR 28.2 LPAin 2024. TISS is another MBA college with low fees and good placements. Companies such as Accenture, Deloitte India, Infosys Consulting, Darwinbox, TCS, Wipro, etc. offer placements to the MBA graduates of TISS.

Pune University Department of Management Sciences (PUMBA)is affiliated with Pune University and has course fees ofINR 2.5 Lakhfor two years. The college accepts scores of exams like CAT/XAT/MAT/CET/ATMA/MAH CET for admission to various MBA courses and offers placements with an average salary ofINR 8.10 LPA. Axis Bank, E-serve, Bee Management, ONGC, Thermax, SBI Life, etc. are a few companies which offer placements to the students studying in this college.

This institute provides admissions based on the CAT exam score which IIMs conduct. The total cost of studying an MBA at this institution isINR 97,000 to INR 99,000for two years.Department of Financial Studiesis known for providing the best ROI. The average salary package offered here isINR 15.5 LPAand the highest package is INR 17.5 LPA in the year 2023.Companies such as DE Shaw, HDFC Bank, JLL, Barclays, Arcesium, Axis Bank, HDFC, SBI, Ministry of Finance etc. are some of the top recruiters for MBA graduates.
